Regulators around the region are leading the charge on responsible innovation and adoption of digital currencies like#USDC. Hear more from our team on the momentum and benefits of digital currency transformation in the APAC region.

This month we are proud to mark the 1-year anniversary of our first-of-a-kind partnership withStellar Development FoundationandUNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, to deliver cash assistance to war-impacted and displaced persons in Ukraine via#USDC. 

Over the past year, recipients have been able to safely receive, spend and save digital cash assistance in the form of USDC into a wallet on their mobile device. 

The program, which is designed to be easy, allows recipients to conveniently convert this assistance to cash, withdrawing their funds in dollars, euros, or local currency via thousands of localMoneyGram Internationallocations, or to transfer the amount to a personal bank account. This support can then be used to cover basic needs like rent, food, medical care and heating during the winter.

Over the past couple of years, the Argentine peso has experienced more than 100% annual inflation, dramatically reducing the value of savings and purchasing power for everyday citizens.

Many Argentinian workers receive their paychecks in Argentine pesos. Converting those pesos to US dollars is a desirable way to retain the value of their hard-earned money, but it’s not feasible to open US dollar bank accounts because of government capital controls. 

That’s whereLemonand#USDCcome in. 👇

Lemon is an Argentina-based crypto exchange and digital wallet that operates in seven Latin American countries. They integrate traditional finance with crypto for their 2.2M users to empower them with better financial services.

By making a stable currency available to users and allowing them to easily spend it in their day-to-day lives, Lemon grew 200x in a period of just 2 years. Partnering with Circle to educate users about the benefits of USDC, Lemon saw USDC use double in the 3rd quarter of 2023 alone. 🔥

Read the full story to see how Lemon uses USDC:https://lnkd.in/g2bXmc4X

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

This month we are proud to mark the 1-year anniversary of our first-of-a-kind partnership withStellar Development FoundationandUNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, to deliver cash assistance to war-impacted and displaced persons in Ukraine via#USDC. 

Over the past year, recipients have been able to safely receive, spend and save digital cash assistance in the form of USDC into a wallet on their mobile device. 

The program, which is designed to be easy, allows recipients to conveniently convert this assistance to cash, withdrawing their funds in dollars, euros, or local currency via thousands of localMoneyGram Internationallocations, or to transfer the amount to a personal bank account. This support can then be used to cover basic needs like rent, food, medical care and heating during the winter.

Over the past couple of years, the Argentine peso has experienced more than 100% annual inflation, dramatically reducing the value of savings and purchasing power for everyday citizens.

Many Argentinian workers receive their paychecks in Argentine pesos. Converting those pesos to US dollars is a desirable way to retain the value of their hard-earned money, but it’s not feasible to open US dollar bank accounts because of government capital controls. 

That’s whereLemonand#USDCcome in. 👇

Lemon is an Argentina-based crypto exchange and digital wallet that operates in seven Latin American countries. They integrate traditional finance with crypto for their 2.2M users to empower them with better financial services.

By making a stable currency available to users and allowing them to easily spend it in their day-to-day lives, Lemon grew 200x in a period of just 2 years. Partnering with Circle to educate users about the benefits of USDC, Lemon saw USDC use double in the 3rd quarter of 2023 alone. 🔥

Read the full story to see how Lemon uses USDC:https://lnkd.in/g2bXmc4X

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

This month we are proud to mark the 1-year anniversary of our first-of-a-kind partnership withStellar Development FoundationandUNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, to deliver cash assistance to war-impacted and displaced persons in Ukraine via#USDC. 

Over the past year, recipients have been able to safely receive, spend and save digital cash assistance in the form of USDC into a wallet on their mobile device. 

The program, which is designed to be easy, allows recipients to conveniently convert this assistance to cash, withdrawing their funds in dollars, euros, or local currency via thousands of localMoneyGram Internationallocations, or to transfer the amount to a personal bank account. profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

Trust is critical. We’ve built our business on it. So we’re energized to take part in this year’sWorld Economic Forum(#WEF) meeting in Davos, Switzerland. Its theme? “Rebuilding Trust.” 

For us, this effort begins by being open about who we are, what we do, how we do it, and why we do it. It’s embedded in our programming, emblazoned on the walls of our Promenade storefront, and enshrined in our values.

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

Circlereposted this Chief Legal Officer and Head of Corporate Affairs at Circle A few weeks ago, I had the privilege of speaking at the Stevens Center for Innovation in Finance atThe Wharton Schoolas part of their FinTech Lecture Series. I gave a talk on the Dollar's Digital Future and why that future matters to Wharton students and to young professionals throughout the country. 

How we digitize the dollar is one of the most critical public policy questions of our time and will determine how we and our children interact with the internet today and into the future. 

The Wharton students were already incredibly knowledgeable on these issues - it was great to see how intelligent and diligent our future public and private sector leaders are. I came away impressed with Wharton and my alma mater, theUniversity of Pennsylvania. The future for digital dollars, and America, is bright!

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

For us, this effort begins by being open about who we are, what we do, how we do it, and why we do it. It’s embedded in our programming, emblazoned on the walls of our Promenade storefront, and enshrined in our values.

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. ⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

Circlereposted this Chief Legal Officer and Head of Corporate Affairs at Circle A few weeks ago, I had the privilege of speaking at the Stevens Center for Innovation in Finance atThe Wharton Schoolas part of their FinTech Lecture Series. I gave a talk on the Dollar's Digital Future and why that future matters to Wharton students and to young professionals throughout the country. 

How we digitize the dollar is one of the most critical public policy questions of our time and will determine how we and our children interact with the internet today and into the future. 

The Wharton students were already incredibly knowledgeable on these issues - it was great to see how intelligent and diligent our future public and private sector leaders are. I came away impressed with Wharton and my alma mater, theUniversity of Pennsylvania. The future for digital dollars, and America, is bright!

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

Digital dollars that deliver efficient financial access across borders. That is one of the powerful real-world use cases of#USDC. Hear more on the evolving financial landscape from#TheMoneyMovementepisode withJeremy Allaireand Sigal Mandelker.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

Latin America is embracing digital finance and the next internet era. See how 👇#DidYouKnow- From mid-2021 to mid-2022, citizens of LatAm countries received $562 billion in digital currency value. 

According to Mastercard, 51% of Latin American consumers have made a purchase with digital currency and one-third have used a stablecoin for everyday purchases. 

This explosive growth is largely fueled by a simple-yet-powerful value proposition — expanded access.

Latin America is primed to drive this shift globally because of: 
👉 Necessity: many populations within the region lack access to analog financial services
👉 Demographics: LatAm has a population of 658 million — roughly double the US. Nearly a quarter of this population is aged 14 or younger, giving LatAm another key advantage over other global regions with aging populations
👉 Developers: there are nearly a million developers in the region who are active in offshore development, much of which is outsourced by American companies
👉 Regulatory support: Fintech is also widely supported by policymakers, since it provides financial authorities with new tools to manage risks and compliance. LatAm fintech sector has recently doubled in size and now features approximately 2500 platforms

Taken together, Latin America’s well-established market demand, policy support and widespread dollar usage make the region a natural fit for broader stablecoin adoption. 

Read the full Executive Insights bySpencer SpinnellandRachel Mayerto learn more about our vision of internet-native financial infrastructure in LatAm.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Trust is critical. We’ve built our business on it. So we’re energized to take part in this year’sWorld Economic Forum(#WEF) meeting in Davos, Switzerland. Its theme? “Rebuilding Trust.” 

For us, this effort begins by being open about who we are, what we do, how we do it, and why we do it. It’s embedded in our programming, emblazoned on the walls of our Promenade storefront, and enshrined in our values.

As we continue into the#OpenMoneyEraat#wef24, we’re hosting dozens of conversations with leading companies from around the world to discuss how, together, we can accelerate a trusted internet financial system. One that’s inherently inclusive, interoperable, and seamless – and that delivers value for billions of people, millions of businesses, and developers everywhere.

Read more on how blockchain networks and digital dollars like#USDCis drastically improving the movement of money across the open internet.https://hubs.li/Q02gh3gw0
Next week 👀#OpenMoneyEra

We’re diving into our#OpenMoneyEra. 👀 

What is Open Money? 

Open money is a big idea, rooted in the open and interoperable design of the internet. Open money can empower almost anyone, anywhere in the world, to access and use dollars on the internet with speed and ease.

Open money unlocks global access to credit markets, banking, enterprise commerce, and financial aid relief that can be delivered nearly instantly, and nearly for free.

Open money is doing for money what the internet did for information: Making it move more economically, quickly, and seamlessly.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

Did you know there are 8 billion prepaid SIM cards globally, with over a billion in Sub-Saharan Africa alone? 

These aren't just for talk, text and data - they're simple stored-value accounts that can be transformed into a virtual debit card.

In Episode 14 of the Builder Series,Sam S.sits down withChristian Duffus, Founder and CEO ofFonbnk, to discuss how Fonbnk* is revolutionizing financial inclusion. 

Learn how Fonbnk is bridging the financial services gap by enabling unbanked and underbanked individuals to convert prepaid mobile airtime into digital currency for various financial transactions.

🎥 Catch the full conversation:https://lnkd.in/gc-DPwx4*Fonbnk is a Circle Mint Customer.

Full keynote session in Paris fromJeremy Allaireis now available. Hear more about:

👉 our company vision
👉 the promise of open blockchain innovation for the internet financial system
👉 the power of dollars on the internet
👉 our Web3 Services to help builders abstract away complexities and improve UX
👉 ... and more!#OpenMoneyEra🎥https://lnkd.in/gnbrhYSp

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

Circlereposted this Chief Legal Officer and Head of Corporate Affairs at Circle A few weeks ago, I had the privilege of speaking at the Stevens Center for Innovation in Finance atThe Wharton Schoolas part of their FinTech Lecture Series. I gave a talk on the Dollar's Digital Future and why that future matters to Wharton students and to young professionals throughout the country. 

How we digitize the dollar is one of the most critical public policy questions of our time and will determine how we and our children interact with the internet today and into the future. 

The Wharton students were already incredibly knowledgeable on these issues - it was great to see how intelligent and diligent our future public and private sector leaders are. I came away impressed with Wharton and my alma mater, theUniversity of Pennsylvania. The future for digital dollars, and America, is bright!

profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

extracted_posts.post_content: “Winning a fierce digital currency space race hinges on unleashing a rules-based free market, rather than constraining it.” -Dante A. DisparteIn his latest for American Banker, Dante shares reflections from his time at TheBank for International Settlements – BISInternational Summit where he joined leaders in banking, regulators and policymakers for conversations on the changing global financial system.

Whether in communications, e-commerce, or education, the progress enabled by internet platforms has followed the same arc: 𝘧𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘳, 𝘧𝘳𝘦𝘦𝘳, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘢𝘪𝘳𝘦𝘳.  

The internet was designed for high speed, low costs, and greater inclusion. And now it's primed to deliver the greatest opportunity of all: 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐞𝐲

We believe that when money is open, businesses, developers, and people around the world can:

👉 Access essential financial services – the blockchain requires no minimum balances or physical locations and has no overdraft fees.
👉 Build the next wave of financial innovation via programmable digital dollars.
👉 Rely on near-instant global money movement – modernizing cross-border payments, remittances, humanitarian aid, charitable giving, money market funds, FX flows, and so much more.

Money is now open. 

Learn more:https://lnkd.in/dY2ZUnMg#OpenMoneyEra

The open internet has changed just about everything in our lives, except the one thing that cuts through it all: Money.

USDC represents a new form of money that is as open as the internet itself. Open, democratic, and accessible. If the open internet unlocked so many ideas we now take for granted today, just imagine where open money could take us.

Money is now open.

The anticipation has peaked, and we are thrilled to announce the winners of our latest Unlocking Impact pitch competition! 🙌

These visionary projects embody the essence of innovation and impact that we strive to nurture and celebrate at Circle.

🥇Ensuro: For developing a decentralized insurance provider supporting smallholder farmers, they will receive 100,000 USDC, mentorship from Circle'sDante A. Disparte, and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Kura (Techstars Payments '24): For revolutionizing cross-border payments, they will receive technical mentorship withAirtmand Circle, along with collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Liquidstar: For establishing innovative renewable energy generating waypoints, they will receive mentorship from Circle and collaboration opportunities withDevex.

🌟Zero Labs: For transforming renewable energy certificates (RECs), they will receive mentorship from theInstitute of International Finance.

A heartfelt thank you to our host for the convening IIF, our esteemed judges:Dante A. DisparteandAndrew Galluccifrom Circle,Hannah Anderson, andRaymond Aycockfrom IIF,Nicole Valentinefrom theMilken Institute,Lisa Claire NestorfromAirtm,Raj Kumarfrom Devex, andAni Popiashvilifrom the World Bank, our moderator:Mercina Tillemann Perez, andCarly McCormickfor steering the third edition of Unlocking Impact.

Stay tuned for updates on our upcoming pitch competitions. 👀

The third edition of our pitch competition, Unlocking Impact, is almost here! 

As we celebrate Earth Day 🌎 our upcoming competition is looking for innovations that address global challenges, including climate change, environmental degradation, and economic instability. 

We are excited to announce the finalists that will share their projects with our panel of judges (Dante A. Disparte,Andrew Gallucci,Institute of International Finance'sHannah Anderson,Milken Institute’sNicole Valentine,Lisa Claire Nestor,Mercy Corps Ventures'Daniel BlockandThe World Bank’sAni Popiashvili) for a chance to win up to $100k in#USDC. 👇

⭐Ensurois building a decentralized capital provider for insurance risk. They use smart contracts to curate competitive insurance portfolios. By opening up the insurance market to new players, Ensuro fuels innovation for established and upcoming insurance partners.

⭐Kura (Techstars Payments '24)is a cross-border remittances platform that enables senders and recipients to track every transaction, ensuring funds are utilized for their intended purpose. Kura partners with local businesses to enable families to access vital goods and services. Kura is driven by a deep commitment to making a meaningful difference in the lives of those who rely on cross-border payments. 

⭐Zero Labsresearches and builds tools that help create new behaviors around renewable energy and the regenerative economy. With simple API solutions, Zero Labs provides digital renewable energy as a service and makes it easy for businesses and individuals to decarbonize operations.  

We wish our finalists the best of luck and thankRaj Kumarfor joiningMercina Tillemann Perezas the pitch competition’s official moderators.

After a rigorous review process of exceptional and innovative solutions that are all harnessing#USDCand blockchain technology to rebuild trust and expand access, the following solutions stood out for their transformative potential and visionary approach. 

🏆 Rahat is an open-source and blockchain-based financial access platform focused on assisting vulnerable communities in Nepal. profile_overview: Circle helps businesses and developers harness the power of stablecoins for payments and internet commerce worldwide.
profile_bio:
Circle is a global financial technology firm that enables businesses of all sizes to harness the power of digital currencies and public blockchains for payments, commerce and financial applications worldwide.

Circle is also the principal operator of USDC, which has become the fastest growing, regulated and fully reserved dollar digital currency. USDC now stands at more than 45 billion and has supported about $1.4 trillion in transactions over the past year.

Today, Circle's transaction and treasury services are giving rise to a new generation of financial services and commerce applications that hold the promise of raising global economic prosperity through the frictionless exchange of financial value.

The Commissioner of Financial Regulation for the State of Maryland will accept all questions or complaints from Maryland residents regarding Circle Internet Financial, LLC (NMLS ID# 1201441) at 1100 North Eutaw Street, Suite 611, Baltimore, MD 21201, phone 1-888-784-0136. Circle's license status can be verified through the NMLS Consumer Access website at https://nmlsconsumeraccess.org.

Circle Internet Financial, LLC is licensed as a Money Transmitter by the New York State Department of Financial Institutions and to engage in Virtual Currency Business Activity by the New York State Department of Financial Services. https://www.circle.com/en/legal/licenses

extracted_posts.post_content:
The open internet has changed just about everything in our lives, except the one thing that cuts through it all: Money.

USDC represents a new form of money that is as open as the internet itself. Open, democratic, and accessible. If the open internet unlocked so many ideas we now take for granted today, just imagine where open money could take us.

Money is now open.

Learn more:https://lnkd.in/dqQcN8sS#OpenMoneyEra

Did you catch us in the wild this week?👇

Digital dollars, like#USDC, enable money to move around the world at the speed of thought, just like other internet data. 

Money is now open.

🎥 LIVE: Ep 97 of#TheMoneyMovementis now available! 

Recorded atMilken Institute's#MIGlobal, watchJeremy Allaire& Michael Milken discuss: 

👉 Eliminating middlemen
👉 Demographic surprises
👉 Fostering trust
👉 Access and inclusion
👉 ...and much more!

“Winning a fierce digital currency space race hinges on unleashing a rules-based free market, rather than constraining it.” -Dante A. DisparteIn his latest for American Banker, Dante shares reflections from his time at TheBank for International Settlements – BISInternational Summit where he joined leaders in banking, regulators and policymakers for conversations on the changing global financial system.

Whether in communications, e-commerce, or education, the progress enabled by internet platforms has followed the same arc: 𝘧𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘳, 𝘧𝘳𝘦𝘦𝘳, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘢𝘪𝘳𝘦𝘳.  

The internet was designed for high speed, low costs, and greater inclusion. And now it's primed to deliver the greatest opportunity of all: 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐞𝐲

We believe that when money is open, businesses, developers, and people around the world can:

👉 Access essential financial services – the blockchain requires no minimum balances or physical locations and has no overdraft fees.
👉 Build the next wave of financial innovation via programmable digital dollars.
👉 Rely on near-instant global money movement – modernizing cross-border payments, remittances, humanitarian aid, charitable giving, money market funds, FX flows, and so much more.

Money is now open. 

Learn more:https://lnkd.in/dY2ZUnMg#OpenMoneyEra
